channel.title: Very simple redstone help plz
channel.description: It's the stupidest thing I basically want 2 pistons. one holding a glowstone, and one a stone block and when I hit a lever the stone block to retract. and the glowstone to extend but I cant figure it out its so easy but im stupid for some reaosn lol

item.title: Very simple redstone help plz
item.dc:creator: @triston001 triston001
item.description:
@triston001 wrote:

ok keep the redstone curcuit for the stone piston, but for glow ston do this (GS)=piston~~(not gate/torch facing the piston and placed on a stone block)~~~(lever)
this should work but its inverted for off and on, off=light, on=shade

dont place the not gate under the piston, and ~ <-- is redstone wire. i did this on a 2-d plane

Read full topic

item.title: Very simple redstone help plz
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

thats definitely not what he said. maybe if he would elaborate instead of saying he just wants 2 blocks to extend/extract. otherwise, it processes through most people’s head like how fuscate built it, only standing upright

either way, i used 2 pistons and did it the exact same way fuscate built it, only standing upright. it works fine just like a light switch

Read full topic

item.title: Very simple redstone help plz
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

hat trix:

its the same concept, only up and down. if you want the blocks to be closer to each other you have to run redstone on both sides of the blocks in order to power them correctly if im not mistaking. could be wrong though

its not the same concept at all… hes talking about hitting a button and a hole opens up in the wall, glowstone comes from the side and is pushed from the hole, hit the button again, the glowstone retracts and the same wall material gets pushed into the hole

Read full topic
